install tensorflow in terminal:

::: {#932655f4 .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import os
os.system('pip install tensorflow')

os.system('pip install numpy  --upgrade')
os.system('pip install pandas  --upgrade')
os.system('pip install matplotlib  --upgrade')
os.system('pip install scikit-learn  --upgrade')
os.system('pip install scipy  --upgrade')
os.system('pip install plotly  --upgrade')
```
:::


::: {#2f07788b .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import sys
#import tensorflow.keras
import keras
import pandas as pd
import sklearn as sk
import scipy as sp
import tensorflow as tf
import platform

print("Python Platform:")
print({platform.platform()})
print("")

print("Tensor Flow Version: ")
print({tf.__version__})
print("")

print("Keras Version: ")
print({keras.__version__})
print("")

print("Python:")
print({sys.version})
print("")

print("Pandas:")
print({pd.__version__})
print("")

print("Scikit-Learn:")
print({sk.__version__})
print("")

print("SciPy:")
print({sp.__version__})
print("")

gpu = len(tf.config.list_physical_devices('GPU'))>0
print("GPU is", "available" if gpu else "NOT AVAILABLE")
```
